apps.name: LiveRedirect
apps.subtitle: Redirect any URLs to LiveContainer! (iOS <26)
apps.localizedDescription:
Open matching webpages in LiveContainer from Safari on iOS using a lightweight Safari Web Extension.

What it does:
• Lets you maintain a list of URL or domain patterns (e.g., discord.com/invite, youtube.com).
• When a visited page matches, the content script encodes the full URL as Base64 and redirects to: livecontainer://open-web-page?url=<base64>
• Manage patterns directly in the extension popup (add, delete, import, export).

Using the extension:
Important: Sideload with app extensions enabled to use extension!
• Add a pattern such as discord.com/invite or just github.com.
• Visit a matching page; you should be redirected to the LiveContainer URL.
• Import/Export via clipboard (JSON or newline list). The popup performs clipboard reads/writes only on user action.

versions.localizedDescription: Manual Redirect Option
Initial Release

apps.name: Pocket Poster
apps.subtitle: Custom PosterBoard Wallpapers for iOS 17+
apps.localizedDescription:
# Pocket Poster
Custom PosterBoard animated wallpapers for iOS 17.0+

Community-made wallpapers can be found on the [official Cowabun.ga site](https://cowabun.ga/wallpapers). Join the [Cowabunga Discord Server](https://discord.gg/cowabunga) for additional help.

## Getting Started
Since there is no way to read files currently, you will need a computer to get the App Hash/UUID.

Download [Nugget](https://github.com/leminlimez/Nugget) on your computer and plug in your phone. Then, navigate to the `Settings` page and click the `Pocket Poster Helper` button. Inside Pocket Poster, click the `Detect` button inside of settings.

## Credits
- Translations crowdsourced using [POEditor][POEditorJoin]. Thank you everyone who assisted in the translation effort!
- [PosterRestore][PosterRestoreDiscord] for their help with PosterBoard
- [dootskyre][dootskyreX] for the fallback shortcut
- [Nathan](https://github.com/verygenericname) and [DuyKhanhTran](https://github.com/khanhduytran0) for the exploit

[POEditorJoin]: https://poeditor.com/join/project/MPZOsunwVj
[PosterRestoreDiscord]: https://discord.gg/gWtzTVhMvh
[dootskyreX]: https://x.com/dootskyre

versions.localizedDescription:
# Features
- Added an in-app explore page for finding and downloading wallpapers
- Added custom CarPlay wallpapers (will not work on iOS 26.0)
- *Preliminary* iOS 16 support (not all wallpapers will work)
- Improved certain error messages

# Bug Fixes
- Fixed the aspect ratio/rotation of imported custom videos
- Fixed the update API not being called correctly
- Fixed issues with some alerts not popping up
- Other various app stability improvements

- Changed how the app hash is gotten (Requires [Nugget v6.1.1 or newer](https://github.com/leminlimez/Nugget/releases/latest))
- Pocket Poster now prompts when there is an update available
- Reset Collections button now falls back to the tutorial screen from v1.0 on iOS 17.0
- Added new languages:
  - Bulgarian
  - Chinese (simplified)
  - French (LU)
  - Italian
- Fixed a bug where the app hash would be pasted incorrectly

This version is outdated, you can find the latest version [here](https://github.com/leminlimez/Pocket-Poster/releases/latest).

# Features
- Added video wallpapers! Select videos from your camera roll and use them as wallpapers.
- The "Reset Collections" button now works automatically
- Added translations for 21 new languages!
  - Available languages: Arabic, Arabic (Saudi Arabia), Arabic (Egypt), Chinese (Traditional), Czech, Dutch, French, French (Belgium), French (Canada), French (Switzerland), German, Hungarian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Spanish (Mexico), Thai, Turkish, Vietnamese
  - Thank you to all the amazing translators who helped make this project more accessible! This would not have been possible without you!
  - If you would like to help translate, you can join the effort over on [POEditor](https://poeditor.com/join/project/MPZOsunwVj)
- Improved the UI
- Prepared for CarPlay hash (coming in v3.0)

# Bug Fixes
- Improved backend handling of the app
- Fixed problems with alert popups not showing
- Improved error messages
- Improved cache clean up
- Fixed memory leak when applying that would lead to a crash

- Initial Release
  - Only .tendies files are currently supported. Configuration-based tendies will not work, however those are rare.

**Note:** You will need [Nugget v5.2.3 or newer](https://github.com/leminlimez/Nugget) to get the app hash.

apps.name: Get More Ram
apps.subtitle: A simple AltSign wrapper app that allows you to enable "Increased Memory Limit" to your sideloaded apps without using Xcode
apps.localizedDescription:
# Get More Ram
A simple [StosSign](https://github.com/stossy11/StosSign) wrapper app that allows you to enable "Increased Memory Limit" for your sideloaded apps without using Xcode.

# How to use
1. Sideload this app
2. Go to settings, sign in your account that you used to sign the app you want to enable "Increased Memory Limit"
3. Go to "App IDs" page
4. Tap Refresh
5. Tap the app you want to enable "Increased Memory Limit"
6. Tap "Add Increased Memory Limit"
7. Reinstall the app from SideStore/AltStore
8. Check if you have "Increased Memory Limit"

# Credits
Stossy11 - For StosSign.
SideStore - Anisette Data fetching codes are stolen from SideStore

versions.localizedDescription: This is a nightly release [created automatically with GitHub Actions workflow](https://github.com/hugeBlack/GetMoreRam/actions/runs/14164044325/attempts/1).

apps.name: Ksign
apps.subtitle: The "cleaner" Esign app.
apps.localizedDescription: # Ksign [![GitHub Release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/nyasami/ksign?style=for-the-badge&color=3c94fc)](https://github.com/nyasami/ksign/releases/latest) [![GitHub Downloads (all assets, all releases)](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/nyasami/ksign/total?style=for-the-badge&color=6bc563)](https://github.com/nyasami/ksign/releases) Yet another codesigning app, have you ever wondered what if Feather and Esign had a child? ## Why? Since Esign is end of service so people been moving to other signing apps, but Esign was a really big part of the community, so with the help of Feather as the base app, I tried to recreate Esign as close as possible so you guys can easier to get familiar and less app switching for smooth sideloading. Another reason is this app was built specifically for Khoindvn to share his certificates, allowing more people to access to sideloading without even have to buy a certificate! ## Help You can create your Issue at [Issue](https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign-public/issues), this will also be the place for you to request a new feature so feel free to make one! You can also join Ksign Discord [here](https://discord.gg/sfbZfQzVdQ) for better communication. ## Download Go to [Releases](https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign-public/releases) and download the newest ipa from there. ## Star History ## Special thanks - Feather by [khcrysalis](https://github.com/khcrysalis/Feather) - Product manager Khoindvn - And you! for using the app ❤️ ## Disclaimer This project is maintained here, on GitHub. Releases are distributed here, on GitHub. We do not currently have a project website outside of this repository. Please make sure to avoid any sites that host our software as they are often malicious and are there to mislead to user.

versions.localizedDescription:
Hawwo everywan its been a while since last update so here's a small update for this time !

## What's Changed
* Notification when finished downloading in background (you can enable in App Features settings) 
* Button that filled bundle ID with certificate's App ID
* add share button to export in logs tab by @Am1nCmd in https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign/pull/59
* remove support of ksign certificate file
* prefix / suffix for app name in signing config
* refactored the IPA Downloader to just Downloads and new features
* some UI changes and better UX

## New Contributors
* @Am1nCmd made their first contribution in https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign/pull/59

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign/compare/v1.5...v1.5.1

Hawwo everywan! The next big update is here, thank you for all your feature request!

## What's Changed
* Bulk Signing (select multiple apps and click on the sign icon)
* Ksign can be run in background now finally! (helpful with downloading ipas and installing them) 
* Logs tab so you can see what's going on under the hood!
* Added experiments signing option from Feather
* Reset cache and storage in reset tab
* Ability to bundle default certificate with app
* Ability to edit text files and make a new one in file manager
* A few small UI changes
##
> [!TIP]
> If you ever wanted to bundle a certificate with Ksign, you can unpack Ksign and adding certificate with example directory tree (with cert.txt is certificate password in plain text):
> ```ts
> Ksign.app
> |__ signing-assets
>      |__ example
>          |__ cert.p12
>          |__ cert.mobileprovision
>          |__ cert.txt
>      |__ example2
>          |__ cert.p12
>          |__ cert.mobileprovision
>          |__ cert.txt
> ```
> Bundle a certificate cannot be easier as Ksign already has all the tools you need!
##
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign/compare/v1.4.1...v1.5

Hallo everywan! small update and a new app icon! ## What's Changed * New default app icon! This one can adapt to Dark Mode and Tint and way more cleaner than old one * A new zip extractor `ZIPFoundation`, you can choose to use this in app's Archive & Extraction settings if importing IPA doesnt work on Zip * Plist Editor just got even better! * Context menu for file manager is back and even better! (the hold on a file row menu) * Edit toolbar is now on top right so ios 26 tabbar doesnt hid it * Move/Export option is now use system picker instead * A few UI changes **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign/compare/v1.4...v1.4.1

Hallo everywan! A new update yay, a few big changes: ## What's Changed - Click on **.ksign** files will **import to app automatically** - Apps in App Store tab now has a **detailed view** - Added **only modify** option, you can find this in signing properties - Added **revoke** check in certificates - Cleaned up and fixed some UI inconsistency in File Manager on ipads - Added **Liquid Glass** appearance - Avoid the **Signing Failed** error upon signing a few apps - Cleaned up a bit UI > Also Ksign now has a AltStore repo, you can import the repo to any services supported AltSource at > https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Nyasami/Ksign/refs/heads/main/repo.json **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign/compare/v1.3.2...v1.4 ## Preview

Hello everyone, a new update no way! What's new in this version:

## What's Changed
* Adjust 'Show Dylibs' to include injected dylibs located in the .app directory by @brynts in https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign-public/pull/27
* Added selection in Library tab for bulk deletion
* Fixed on automatically adding Tweaks in Tweaks folder
## New Contributors
* @brynts made their first contribution in https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign-public/pull/27

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Nyasami/Ksign-public/compare/v1.3.1...v1.3.2

_Hello_ everyone, finally done with my finals hopefully i can pass it all, also here comes v1.3.1
what's new in this version:
- Added Delete after install feature - you can enable this in signing options
- Add a new small icon under every app to indicate which repo it was from
- Remake the Downloader
- Added back the UI tint color customization
- Added back option to change app icon
- Updated Zsign to properly fix the unable to verify app integrity without replace the framework (thank you khcrysalis!)
- Clean up a bit UI

Nothing much from v1.3, happy sideloading!

It's been a long time, what's new in this version:
- FIxed the **Unable to install** apps bug (Unable to verify integrity)
- Brought back the **Tweaks** folder which was removed in v1.2 - you can find this in App folder
- New File importing method to Files tab which is now instant for any file sizes
- Fixed issue when using IPA downloader would freeze at 100% 
- Fixed the bug that caused incorrect bundle identifier install with Sign & Install function
- .ksign files are now works across any Ksign bundle
- **Higher Encryption** on .ksign files

That's all, hopefully you guys can sideload more smoothly on this version, happy sideloading!
just a small update from the previous version which has no affect in particularly (hopefully)
### Version 1.2.0 This update fixed all the import bugs and others installing bugs, also adding some new features

apps.name: BTLoader (Discord)
apps.subtitle: 💧 BTLoader! The Future For iOS.
apps.localizedDescription:
# 💧 BTLoader

Tweak to inject [Ra1n](https://github.com/ra1ncord/ra1n) into Discord and perform various tasks.

**We at BTLoader wish to clarify that while BTLoader is intended to load Ra1n upon its release, this functionality is not yet available. Consequently, BTLoader currently loads the Kettu Bundle.**

## Installation

The latest builds can be found in the [Releases](https://github.com/CloudySn0w/BTLoader/releases) tab.

## Legacy Of BTLoader

Read about our history here at [The Legacy Of BTLoader](TheLegacyOfBT.md).

versions.localizedDescription:
✅ | Download the latest stable build here.

## Downloads

- **bound.ipa**: BTLoader with Bound name and icon
- **discord.ipa**: BTLoader with original Discord name and icon
- **DEB**: Rootless package for jailbroken devices

## Versions

- Discord: v305.0
- BTLoader: v1.0.1

## Features

- TrollStore compatibility  
- Optimized for size and performance

⚠️ OLD | Download the old stable build here.

_PS: For those who noticed—Kettu now officially supports iOS with properly fixed themes! My friend https://github.com/bwlok also made improvements, so BTLoader runs better than ever. KettuTweak is simply for jailbroken users. BTLoader will continue providing builds for the foreseeable future. Go show Cocobo1 some love for their work on Kettu for iOS!_

- **DEB**: Rootless package for jailbroken devices

## Versions

- Discord: v303.0
- BTLoader: v1.0.1

## Features

- Optimized for size and performance

⚠️ OLD | Download the old stable build here.

_PS: Waited out the 301 release. Hopefully now BTLoader loads Kettu by default rather than Revenge. Make sure now to join the Kettu server and show some love!._

## Downloads

- **bound.ipa**: BTLoader with Bound name and icon
- **discord.ipa**: BTLoader with original Discord name and icon
- **DEB**: Rootless package for jailbroken devices

## Versions

- Discord: v301.0

_PS: The next testing release is likely to be version 300. We hope it works as always. Also, I just realised we have like 92 stars. That’s genuinely insane! Thank you all for being here! Never expected it to become this popular._

## Downloads

- **bound.ipa**: BTLoader with Bound name and icon
- **discord.ipa**: BTLoader with original Discord name and icon
- **DEB**: Rootless package for jailbroken devices

## Versions

- Discord: v297.0
- BTLoader: v1.0.0

*PS: I recently realised that I hadn’t been keeping the stable build properly up to date and was mainly pushing out occasional testing releases instead. I’ve decided to fix that and bring the stable release in line. Based on what I’ve seen, version 294 is currently the recommended one to be on. I’ll continue releasing and personally testing the experimental builds as well. While the outlook for sideloading isn’t looking particularly bright at the moment, I’ll keep working on and using this app for as long as it’s useful to me.*

*Also I will try to update the build script as soon as I get the energy so that it uploads the DEB file here for y'all to use.*

apps.name: Ferrite
apps.subtitle: A media search engine for iOS with debrid support

versions.localizedDescription:
Ferrite v0.7.4 has been released.

Downloading from releases? Get the zip file. The ipa file may not work!

Changelog:

- Fix encoding URLs with POST queries. The app was not percent encoding URLEncoded POST request bodies. Fix this to avoid errors from websites expecting these encoded strings.
- Temporarily disable liquid glass. Liquid glass breaks some parts of Ferrite's UI. Disable it for now and fix this in the future.
- Make TorBox a more prominent debrid option. TorBox is a way better service and API than RealDebrid at this point and should get more traction.

Ferrite v0.7.3 has been released.

Downloading from releases? Get the zip file. The ipa file may not work!

Notes: RealDebrid and AllDebrid's APIs have drastically changed. It is now impossible to retrieve if an item is cached within their database. Ferrite relies on this type of endpoint for rich display of instantly available magnets.

The workaround: A user's magnet library now serves as the instant availability cache. There is now a manual `Download to Debrid` button on the context menu for each search result and bookmark so a user can manually queue a magnet for downloading. If the magnet is instantly available, it'll show the file contents as before and add the magnet to the user's instant availability cache (making the debrid badge green!).

Here's a picture showing where this new button is located:
![Simulator Screenshot - iPhone 16 Pro - 2024-11-27 at 23 24 38](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/85735a40-2a4b-4aea-bbfa-b0ba0049b3ec)

At this time, I do not recommend using RealDebrid or AllDebrid. However, the above workaround makes these services useable. This UI will improve with upcoming releases.

Changelog:
- Add a context menu button to manually cache a search result/bookmark to debrid
- Adapt to RealDebrid and AllDebrid's API changes
- Fix settings menu showing if a debrid is enabled or disabled

Ferrite v0.7.2 has been released as a hotfix.

Downloading from releases? Get the **zip** file. The ipa file may not work!

Changelog:
- Fix RealDebrid to adhere to their new API spec. Rich display for a user's cloud magnets is no longer supported due to these changes
- Add some extra cleanup handlers for the debrid manager. This should fix some undefined errors.

Ferrite v0.7.1 has been released.

**This is the last release for iOS 15**

Downloading from releases? Get the **zip** file. The ipa file may not work!

Changelog:
- Overhauled the internal logic for Debrid services
- Added support for sources that include "library-like" listings via the {queryFirstLetter} param
- Add TorBox and OffCloud support
- Fixed seeder list with htmlParser
- Add the ability to set request headers and body in a Plugin
- Cleanup and fix bugs + UI issues

Ferrite v0.7.0 has been released.

Changelog:
- Overhaul the app to support iOS 15 min version APIs
- Add filters to the searchbar. These include sources, debrid options, debrid cache status, and sorting. The UI is inspired from GitHub's iOS app
- Fix scope bar not showing up on iOS 16.4 and above
- Switch plugin system to primarily use the YAML markup language. YAML is more flexible to work with compared to JSON files which can feel rigid. JSON can still be used, but YAML is the preferred plugin language and JSON is considered to be deprecated.
- Add the ability to manually refresh library cloud and plugin views
- Fix searching for some sources that use an API. I over-hardened the scraping system
- Make search URL request timeouts configurable with the option to disable them if needed. This is helpful for slower networks and if a website gets a large amount of traffic and slows down result fetching.
- Add about and website options for plugins. These supersede the baseURL parameters in sources

**Versions for 0.7 and up only support iOS 15**

v0.6.4 has been released as a hotfix

**This version supports iOS 14**

Changelog:
- Fix plugin install bug which crashes Ferrite on devices running iOS 14

Version 0.6.3 has been released as a hotfix. 

**This version supports iOS 14**

Changelog:
- Fix plugin button appearance
- Show what plugin list a plugin came from in the catalog before installing
- Change how the install button looks and works (no longer have to tap the cell to install a plugin)
- Change source settings to plugin options which shows the information for any installed plugin
- Fix animation when showing plugin options sheet

Ferrite v0.6.2 has been released.

Changelog:

- External playback support via Kodi has been added. Multiple servers can be used.
- Actions now differentiate based on a user's OS
- All fetching is done in parallel which increases the speed of grabbing results from various requests
- A logging window has been added to aggregate logs together in the event of issues (necessary for parallel fetching)
- The autocorrect searchbar option has been properly fixed
- Default actions have been fixed to include user-added and hardcoded actions
- The Ferrite updater is now restricted to a minimum OS version (ex. v0.7 will be for iOS 15 and up which means that iOS 14 won't get update notifications)
- Various iOS 14 fixes have been added to enhance the experience for users still on that version

**This is the last release that supports iOS 14. Please update your iDevice to iOS 15 or higher for v0.7 and up!**
v0.6.2 will always be available in the releases page for those who use iOS 14.

Ferrite v0.6.1 has been released.

Changelog:
- Sources are now called "Plugins" since they encompass both Sources and Actions. Source Lists are now called "Plugin Lists"
- Actions are here! These are user-programmable plugins that allow a user to open links (debrid or magnet) in the app of their choice. Actions can be installed from the plugins catalog in Ferrite
- Refactored the UI to have greater consistency and fluidity (iOS 15/16)
- Fixed some source parsing issues and made the parsers more efficient
- Fixed plugin catalogs having problems when deleting/updating entries
- Plugins now have tag support
- subName has been added for aggregate sources that grab information from other websites
- More bugs squashed and improvements

Version 0.6.0 has been released

Changelog:

- Added support for AllDebrid and Premiumize. To switch between debrids, select the button on the top-right corner in library or search. This is also present while searching.
  
- Added the ability to view, play, and edit a user's debrid cloud (torrents, downloads, items, etc) depending on the service
  
- Library is now searchable! Bookmarks, history, and a user's debrid cloud can be searched to find a specific query
  
- Add more indications in the about view regarding which commit and build type a user is on (Stable, Nightly, or Debug)
  
- Further improvements and bugfixes

Version 0.5.1 has been released as a hotfix.

Fixes an error where backup restoration from files does not create a prompt in Ferrite and causes the app to not open.
All other features are the same as the v0.5.0 release.

Donations are welcome at: https://ko-fi.com/kingbri

Version 0.5.0 has been released.

Changelog:

- Added bookmarks and history functionality
- Information about the played result is shown when selecting a player
- A limit has been added to search results to display a maximum of 4 lines
- Real debrid fetch and recache times have been improved to check if the media is cached instead of redownloading every time
- If Real debrid decides to remove cache for media, Ferrite lets the user know of an API mismatch
- Massive UI improvements
- Backups support (uses .feb which is analogous to a JSON file)
- Scraping errors now say which source is the problem

Donations are welcome at: https://ko-fi.com/kingbri

Version 0.4.0 has been released.

Important: A reinstall is *required* for this version of Ferrite. This is due to a full rewrite of the underlying database.

Changelog:
- Sources now support the use of website JSON APIs (http get requests only!)
- An in-app updater has been added to let users know when there's an app update and to view all previous versions
- A loading indicator has been added for debrid because it takes time to queue up a video depending on the network connection
- Fallback URLs can be added to a source if the existing URL fails. This does not work with the rssUrl and apiUrl parameters
- Fix issues with iOS versions <14.5

Donations are welcome at: https://ko-fi.com/kingbri

Version 0.3.3 has been released.

Changelog:
- Add iOS 14 support
- Fix iPad searchbar randomly closing on keypress
- Fix the saving of modified source lists
- Add more software improvements

Version 0.3.2 has been released.

Changelog:
- Add default actions for search results. These can be configured via settings.
- Allow for self-hosted sources to be created
- Fixup backend for searching and scraping to make the app smoother
- Tell the user when there's no results from a search

Version 0.3.1 has been released.

Changelog (includes v0.3.0)
- Add RSS support for sources
- Make source information prettier and allow users to choose the fetcher (scraping/RSS)
- Editable source lists to preserve updates across different URLs
- Add source update mechanisms when a developer releases a new version
- New app icon!
- Make sure searches only run one at a time
- Alert a user when copying a link in the choice sheet
- Other stuff that I probably forgot to mention

apps.name: PancakeStore
apps.subtitle: MuffinStore Jailed, but with a proper UI.
apps.localizedDescription:
![Artboard](https://github.com/jailbreakdotparty/PancakeStore/blob/main/previewIcon.png)
# PancakeStore
**MuffinStore Jailed, but with a proper UI. iOS 16.4 and later.**

[Latest Release](https://github.com/jailbreakdotparty/PancakeStore/releases/latest) • [Support Server](https://jailbreak.party/discord) • [Website](https://jailbreak.party) • [Original Project (by mineek)](https://github.com/mineek/MuffinStoreJailed-Public)
>[!WARNING]
>Use this tool at your own risk! You may lose app data, and other damage could occur.

## Features
- Downgrade most applications available on the App Store (you will need to input the link to the app store app).

## How do I downgrade an application?
1. The application you want to downgrade will need to be uninstalled. If you want to keep the app data, offload the app first.
2. Install PancakeStore using your preferred sideloading method.
3. Log in your Apple ID, and click "Send 2FA Code." If you can, try sending a 2FA code before logging in (there should be this in the settings app, but it was removed in iOS 18?).
4. In most cases, you should get a popup. Accept the new login, and copy the verification code into the 2FA field. If you don't get that popup, type six random numbers into the 2FA field. I assume this works because you must've logged into MuffinStoreJailed/PancakeStore at a different time. 
5. Click "log in" and go to the App Store.
6. Find the application you're looking for, click the share button, and copy the link.
7. Go back to PancakeStore and click the clipboard button.
8. Click "Downgrade App" and wait patiently!

versions.localizedDescription:
>[!WARNING]
>Use this tool at your own risk! You may lose app data, and other damage could occur.

[Support Server](https://jailbreak.party/discord) • [Website](https://jailbreak.party) • [Original Project (by mineek)](https://github.com/mineek/MuffinStoreJailed-Public)

first release lol, probably will be the only one unless there's some major issue or something. read the [readme](https://github.com/jailbreakdotparty/PancakeStore) for instructions.

news.title: LiveRedirector Solution for iOS 26!
news.caption: Fix broken sideloaded Safari extension using Userscripts + Shortcuts
